# Khawara

Khawara (हिन्दी: खवाड़ा), sometimes spelled Khawada, is a village in the Ghansali tehsil of Tehri Garhwal district, located in the Indian state of Uttarakhand. It is a part of the Garhwal Himalayas and is governed by a local Gram Panchayat.
Geography
Khawara is situated in a hilly region within the Tehri Garhwal district. The village uses the PIN code 249155 for its postal services.
Demographics
Based on the 2011 Census of India, the village of Khawara was home to 937 people living in 212 households, including 435 males and 502 females.
The literacy rate in Khawara is 69.68%. However, there is a noticeable difference in literacy rates between men and women, with male literacy at 90.49% and female literacy at 52.67%.
